definition: Yuan Haowen (1190-1257), famous poet Northern China during the Jin-Yuan transition
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to ask

sentences.english: The poet of Yuan Haowen showes how greatly emotion would influence people.
sentences.chinese: 元好问的这句词，道出了情感对人的巨大影响。

sentences.english: The famous poet Yuan Haowen in Jin kingdom thinks highly of poet Bai Juyi of the middle Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 金源著名诗人元好问对中唐诗人白居易颇为推崇。

sentences.english: And the relationship between Yuan Haowen and Bai Juyi deserves further discussion.
sentences.chinese: 元好问与白居易之间的关系值得进一步探讨。

sentences.english: Yuan Hao-wen made a systematic Study on poetry in Song dynasty e…
sentences.chinese: 金代系统研究宋诗特别是苏诗的是元好问。

sentences.english: Zhongzhouji is compiled by Yuan Haowen, who is a great poet and criticism of Jin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《中州集》是元好问编纂的金代诗词集。

sentences.english: It is typical in Yuan Haowen s epitaphs "to portray a character in narrating events".
sentences.chinese: “以事写人”是元好问碑志文的重要特色。

definition: Bai Pu (1226-1306), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧 tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan dramatists 元曲四大家
Lu You (1125-1210), widely regarded as the greatest of the Southern Song poets
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Li Shangyin (c. 813-858), Tang poet
Bai Juyi (772-846), Tang dynasty poet
Wang Shizhen (1634-1711), early Qing poet

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Han Yu (768-824), Tang dynasty essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements
Kong Shangren (1648-1718), Qing dramatist and poet, author of The Peach Blossom Fan 桃花扇[Tao2 hua1 Shan4]
Ma Zhiyuan (c. 1250-1321), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧[za2 ju4] tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan Dramatists 元曲四大家[Yuan2 qu3 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Wang Shifu (fl. 1295-1307), author of Romance of the West Chamber 西廂記|西厢记
Liu Yuxi (772-842), Tang poet
Liu Zongyuan (773-819), Tang essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements
Wang Yucheng (954-1001) Song dynasty literary figure
Li Qingzhao (1084-c. 1151), southern Song female poet
Yu Xin (513-581), poet from Liang of the Southern dynasties 南朝梁朝 and author of Lament for the South 哀江南賦|哀江南赋
